course_description: This course focuses on interactions between human activities and geologic processes. Topics include floods, earthquakes, volcanism, risk and resilience, air and water pollution, mineral and energy resources and climate change.
prerequisites: ENVS 120 or ENVS 130 or ENVS 131 or ENVS_OX 131 or ENVS 140 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
schedule_location: MW 1pm-2:15pm in Math & Science Center - N302
sections: Class Nbr: 2843, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 1-2:15p, Instructor: A. Martin, Status: Open
